title: Leviathan_ Or The Matter, Forme - Thomas Hobbes.epub
description:
Written by Thomas Hobbes and first published in 1651, Leviathan is widely considered the greatest work of political philosophy ever composed in the English language. Hobbes's central argumentÃ¢â‚¬â€that human beings are first and foremost concerned with their own fears and desires, and that they must relinquish basic freedoms in order to maintain a peaceful societyÃ¢â‚¬â€has found new adherents and critics in every generation. This new edition, which uses modern text and relies on large-sheet copies from the 1651 Head version, includes interpretive essays by four leading Hobbes scholars: John Dunn, David Dyzenhaus, Elisabeth Ellis, and Bryan Garsten. Taken together with Ian ShapiroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s wide-ranging introduction, they provide fresh and varied interpretations of Leviathan for our time.
Genre: Nonfiction, general
